items.question: What is OrdinalsLite.Market?
items.answer: OrdinalsLite.Market is an open-source, zero-fee, trustless Litecoin NFT marketplace based on partially signed litecoin transactions.

items.question: What is OpenOrdEx?
items.answer: OpenOrdEx is an open source zero-fee trustless Bitcoin NFT marketplace based on Partially Signed Bitcoin Transactions.

items.question: Who contributed to the project?
items.answer: The contributors to the project include jamesscaur, orenyomtov, and LitecoinLabs.

items.question: How does the marketplace work?
items.answer: Sellers create a partially signed litecoin transaction specifying the price of the ordinal. Buyers can sign this transaction and broadcast it to the network to complete the purchase.

items.question: What are Partially Signed Litecoin Transactions?
items.answer: Partially Signed Litecoin Transactions (PSLTs) are a type of transaction where the seller specifies certain terms, such as price, but leaves it incomplete for the buyer to sign. This method allows for trustless transactions in the marketplace.

items.question: How are PSLTs used in OrdinalsLite.Market?
items.answer: In OrdinalsLite.Market, sellers use PSLTs to set the price of their NFTs. Buyers can complete these transactions by signing and broadcasting them, facilitating a secure and trustless exchange.

items.question: How can I add my collection to OrdinalsLite.Market?
items.answer: To have your collection listed, create a pull request on the litecoinlabs/collections repo. Collections are displayed in a random order on the homepage.

items.question: How are collections viewed on the marketplace?
items.answer: All inscriptions can be viewed directly via their inscription number or ID.

items.question: Where can I find more information or contribute to the project?
items.answer: More information and contribution details can be found on the project's GitHub repository at https://github.com/litecoinlabs/market.

items.question: What is the project's social media presence?
items.answer: The project can be followed on Twitter at https://twitter.com/OrdinalsLiteMkt and more details are available on the website https://ordinalslite.market.
